category: Articles of Incorporation/Article 8 (Convening and Resolution of Board of Directors)
contents: Article 8 (Convening and resolution of the Board of Directors) ① The Board of Directors shall be convened when necessary or when more than 1/3 of the registered directors request the Chairman, and the Chairman of the Board of Directors shall preside over the meeting. When convening a board of directors meeting, the purpose must be specified and notified to each director at least 7 days prior to the meeting. However, this does not apply when all directors meet and all of them request a meeting of the board of directors., ② The board of directors opens with the attendance of a majority of registered directors and makes decisions with the approval of a majority of registered directors., ③ Agenda and special interests of the board of directors. The chairman or directors who are related cannot participate in the resolution of the agenda. In this case, directors, etc. who cannot participate in the resolution are not included in the number of members pursuant to the provisions of paragraph 2., ④ The Board of Directors holds the meeting twice a year and holds it from time to time when necessary., ⑤ Auditors attend the Board of Directors meetings and state their opinions. can do.
